intro: Boehmeria bullata subsp. coriacea, commonly known as the rough Boehmeria, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes nettles and related species. The plant is characterized by its hairy, rough-textured leaves and small, greenish-white flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and wetlands. Its fibrous stems have been used historically for making textiles and paper.
